definition: many thanks/thanks a lot
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
to thank/to apologize/to wither (of flowers, leaves etc)/to decline
surname Xie

sentences.english: We have arrived in Tsuen Wan, please exit from the train, thank you.
sentences.chinese: 本班列车已经抵达荃湾站，请所有乘客落车，多谢。

sentences.english: Thanks for looking after the house while we were away.
sentences.chinese: 多谢我们不在的时候帮我们照看房子。

sentences.english: Thanks to Mr. Li Jing's donation, we will provide free pizza for lunch.
sentences.chinese: 多谢李竞先生的捐款，中午将提供免费比萨。

sentences.english: Thanks a lot , but I can do it myself.
He also thanked the exhibition's organising committee headed by Mr John Man and Mrs Irene So.
sentences.chinese: 他并多谢画展的筹委会共同主席文锡辉及苏潘慕洁。

sentences.english: If you want to download any pictures, please inform the webmaster. Thank you!
sentences.chinese: 如欲借用本网任何图文，请先联络网主，多谢合作。

sentences.english: Thanks to your help(raises her wine-glass). To our friendship. A:Bottoms up .
sentences.chinese: 多谢你的帮助，为我们的友谊于杯。

sentences.english: Mrs. Lo thank you for introducing me to Dr. Chung.
sentences.chinese: 卢太多谢你介绍钟医生给我。

sentences.english: Many thanks for your letter and enclosures of 12 September.
sentences.chinese: 多谢9月12日的来信和附件。

sentences.english: We have arrived in Tiu Keng Leng, please exit from the train, thank you.
sentences.chinese: 本班列车已经抵达调景岭站，请所有乘客落车，多谢。

sentences.english: The train for Tiu Keng Leng is arriving, please let passengers exit first. Thank you.
sentences.chinese: 往调景岭列车即将到站，请先让乘客落车，多谢合作。

sentences.english: Thank you, Xuchang pass Yashi, Shu have no knowledge poet.
sentences.chinese: 多谢许昌传雅什，蜀都曾未识诗人。

sentences.english: Big Dan advances that don't shower your cat by toilet brush, thank you for your cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 奉大丹谕请勿使用厕所刷帮猫只洗澡，多谢合作。

sentences.english: Please bring this advice with you on the day of the seminar. Thank You.
sentences.chinese: 请带同此通知书到本中心参加研讨会，多谢合作。

definition: can't thank sb enough (idiom)
(polite) thank you for your trouble (used when asking a favor or after having received one)
to be indebted (to sb)
to cup one fist in the other hand (as a sign of respect)
to speak seriously/to exaggerate
to bow
to express thanks
to inconvenience/to trouble (sb with a request)
to cup one's hands in obeisance or greeting/(fig.) submissive
to express gratitude (esp. in public)/vote of thanks/also written 鳴謝|鸣谢
to overpraise/to flatter
to salute/to greet
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
you're welcome/don't mention it/no need to stand on ceremony
to be grateful/to appreciate/thankful
to half rise out of one's chair (a polite gesture)
